name: banksia
content:

any of a family of evergreen trees and bushes (= ones that never lose their leaves) from Australia, with usually yellow flowers: The variety of banksia in my garden has orangey yellow flowers. Banksia trees have evolved to release their seeds into the hot air in the event of a fire. More than 75 banksia, melaleucas, eucalyptus and other introduced species in the park have been killed over the past six years.
More examplesFewer examplesBanksias can be grown as container plants in a greenhouse or conservatory.Banksias and eucalyptus trees grow well in hot sandy conditions and are often found on the shoreline.We rested in the shade of a splendid banksia.
